title: newuser001122
author: newuser001122
created_time: May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMLast edit: May 05, 2023, 08:48:31 AM by newuser001122
content: lost gmail account and its impossible to recover:/

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMi wonder how much can be done without a password and recovery options? What wallet or service are you talking about? Did you have a non-custodial wallet with a seed phrase (a series of words)? Do you have an encrypted wallet file and you have forgotten the password? Or you are talking about a custodial service?Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMsome people around say they have talked to a reprensitive and provided sensitive details about the account and got it back? or is it all just bs and only for paid accounts ?  I hope someone isn't trying to scam you.

comments.author: newuser001122
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on May 04, 2023, 05:17:22 PMQuote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMi wonder how much can be done without a password and recovery options? What wallet or service are you talking about? Did you have a non-custodial wallet with a seed phrase (a series of words)? Do you have an encrypted wallet file and you have forgotten the password? Or you are talking about a custodial service?Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMsome people around say they have talked to a reprensitive and provided sensitive details about the account and got it back? or is it all just bs and only for paid accounts ?  I hope someone isn't trying to scam you. my privatekey logins to crypto is encrypted with a pgp message on my gmail,I forgot the password and was retarded enough to put some random email / phone number as recovery and ended up being locked out of the account for years now im wondering if anyone serious can point my in the right direction? Already tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:22:32 PMmy privatekey logins to crypto is encrypted with a pgp message on my gmail,I forgot the password and was retarded enough to put some random email / phone number as recovery and ended up being locked out of the account for years now im wondering if anyone serious can point my in the right direction? Already tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.Then that's unfortunately cannot be recovered. If you don't know or have all the asked recovery options then easy to say you can't recover it. Brute force attack may be an option but if you don't what it is and how to do it, well, it's the end of it.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:22:32 PMAlready tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.Google doesn't require any payment to recover an account, and any claims to the contrary are likely scams. While it's true that the Google support forum may not always provide a satisfactory solution, there are other options available such as contacting Google support directly or seeking help from a trusted IT professional. If Google support is unable to assist you, then it may be time to accept that your old account is lost for good. Honestly, storing your backup and login information on a third-party mail service was not a smart move in the first place. You should know better than to rely on external providers for something as important.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: It's going to be very hard to recover your account, or probably impossible.The problem is, they don't know who exactly is claiming to be the owner of the account. Some questions they usually ask are date of birth and perhaps the time your account was created. Try to engage the Gmail support as much as possible.But why would you set up a fake recovery number and secondary email for an email address that potentially holds keys to your investments?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on May 04, 2023, 11:10:07 PMBut why would you set up a fake recovery number and secondary email for an email address that potentially holds keys to your investments?Just for the sole purpose of filling the requirements even though those are non-existent, i bet.Quote from: decodx on May 04, 2023, 10:18:12 PMHonestly, storing your backup and login information on a third-party mail service was not a smart move in the first place. You should know better than to rely on external providers for something as important.I did it too actually, but only for some kind of accounts not for financial related. Although i do every backups of the email, from email backup, phone, keys and 2fa just in case.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMi have a gmail account thats a few years old  . the recovery options i added is example like customers@yahoo.com phone num: 4444444444 with a country prefix i can't recall. stupid i know but i wasent expecting crypto to blow up like this.How far in years are we talking about? Where did you get your throwaway accounts for recovery?Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMsome people around say they have talked to a reprensitive and provided sensitive details about the account and got it back? or is it all just bs and only for paid accounts ?  looking at the google support forum its pretty much useless. Representative from google? they don't do personal support for this. All are consolidated through the self-help account recovery page when you try to login. Seeing that they're asking for sensitive details as well, it is likely a scam.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:22:32 PMmy privatekey logins to crypto is encrypted with a pgp message on my gmail,I forgot the password and was retarded enough to put some random email / phone number as recovery and ended up being locked out of the account for years now im wondering if anyone serious can point my in the right direction? Already tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.You have to do it yourself don't believe that any guy can help you for a fee, they'll just scam you, there is an option on when you created Gmail on the recovery have you undergone this process, or part of the process is to log in on one of the devices you've used to log in to that account did the process ask you to do this.I don't know if this will work for you but I read one guy who hypnotized himself so he can remember his password for his Gmail, you have a tough luck recovering your Gmail.This is a big lesson to all of us to secure our email or files if we have something important on it like our private keys.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.created_time: May 05, 2023, 10:29:48 PMLast edit: May 06, 2023, 11:46:16 AM by BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:22:32 PMAlready tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.Why use random people to recover your Gmail they won't be able to do anything about recovering your account. Only ask Google about recovering your account and maybe they will also ask for KYC this is just based on my old experience they ask for KYC to recover my account but I just ignore it until my Gmail account got deleted by Google.Another thing is have you tried to recover it through your mobile number?

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on May 05, 2023, 10:29:48 PMAnother thing is have you tried to recover it through your mobile number? Apparently, the mobile number he used was a fake one so there is no way of recovering the account via mobileYou probably missed the post since he deleted it now but this is what he saidQuote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:08:53 PMi have a gmail account thats a few years old  . the recovery options i added is example like customers@yahoo.com phone num: 4444444444 with a country prefix i can't recall. stupid i know but i wasent expecting crypto to blow up like this.Archive

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 04, 2023, 05:22:32 PMmy privatekey logins to crypto is encrypted with a pgp message on my gmail,I forgot the password and was retarded enough to put some random email / phone number as recovery and ended up being locked out of the account for years now im wondering if anyone serious can point my in the right direction? Already tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.As long as the device on which you created the account and the user IP you know, there is a chance, albeit small, of recovering your account.Stop sending more messages to Google and try to remember more information, if this was years ago, your chance will be less.QuoteAlready tried the online form 100s of times but is there any real help I can get from google without sending upfront payments to random scammers.I do not think that what you are looking for is legal, as hacking your private email is considered an illegal act, and therefore you need to search in the dark internet sites, and you will not find a reliable account that enables you to do so, so do not enjoy the scammers and waste your money.

comments.author: newuser001122
comments.body: i used the  same password on another site but the site owner is not responding and im afraid of if doing anything stupid he might change my password.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 08:31:51 AMi used the  same password on another site but the site owner is not responding and im afraid of if doing anything stupid he might change my password.Please elaborate your situation.What website are we talking about here? - check bolded bit. Am I correct to assume you think you used the same password in your gmail account?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 08:31:51 AMi used the same password on another site but the site owner is not responding and im afraid of if doing anything stupid he might change my password.What site exactly you are pointing to?About your email if you don't have control of the phone number that you added to your Gmail before then how about the phone where your Gmail was login?When recovering a Gmail on the "Google Recovery email" page there are many options to access Gmail if you don't have the number or other email connected to your Gmail there is another option "Try another way" where Gmail will ask I think to grant access your Gmail without the password. Sample this mine I tried to recover or log in without the password using the "Try another way" it asks to my phone if I will grant access to this new device.Just go to your phone and type that code.If it didn't work and If you still using the phone where you log in to this Gmail and it is logout now try to recover it using that phone sometimes it works.

comments.author: newuser001122
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on May 06, 2023, 11:59:38 AMQuote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 08:31:51 AMi used the  same password on another site but the site owner is not responding and im afraid of if doing anything stupid he might change my password.Please elaborate your situation.What website are we talking about here? - check bolded bit. Am I correct to assume you think you used the same password in your gmail account?yes its another email service that is hosted on the thor network and the site admin is ignoring all my requests to recover the that password.its the same password as i used for that gmail and the gmail was created over a VPN and only acessed over VPNS with diffrent ip ads.im in the process of figuring out the phone number attached and try to purchase it if its in use but it seems almost impossible to find the correct number even though i know  its something stupid like the recovery mail customers@yahoo.com same goes for the password something very weak 8-15 chars max .last time i tried to log into the account was in 2017 and was locked out and has not been able to login since and i forgot the password..

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 12:47:40 PMQuote from: Potato Chips on May 06, 2023, 11:59:38 AMQuote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 08:31:51 AMi used the  same password on another site but the site owner is not responding and im afraid of if doing anything stupid he might change my password.Please elaborate your situation.What website are we talking about here? - check bolded bit. Am I correct to assume you think you used the same password in your gmail account?yes its another email service that is hosted on the thor network and the site admin is ignoring all my requests to recover the that password.its the same password as i used for that gmail and the gmail was created over a VPN and only acessed over VPNs with diffrent ip ads.im in the process of figuring out the phone number attached and try to purchase it if its in use but it seems almost impossible to find the correct number even though i know  its something stupid like the recovery mail customers@yahoo.com.You should name that email provider, stop holding back if you want help in recovering your email and I doubt if they will give you the password you've used, they usually sent out change password link to change your password so you can recover the account.They will ignore your request because you have to first established that you own the email and do check their terms when sending out this kind of request because it might not be part of their terms, they think they might end up helping scammers or hackers.

comments.author: newuser001122

Am I correct to assume you think you used the same password in your gmail account?yes its another email service that is hosted on the thor network and the site admin is ignoring all my requests to recover the that password.its the same password as i used for that gmail and the gmail was created over a VPN and only acessed over VPNs with diffrent ip ads.im in the process of figuring out the phone number attached and try to purchase it if its in use but it seems almost impossible to find the correct number even though i know  its something stupid like the recovery mail customers@yahoo.com.You should name that email provider, stop holding back if you want help in recovering your email and I doubt if they will give you the password you've used, they usually sent out change password link to change your password so you can recover the account.They will ignore your request because you have to first established that you own the email and do check their terms when sending out this kind of request because it might not be part of their terms, they think they might end up helping scammers or hackers.trust me after a year of messaging this site owner its impossible to reach a deal with him and this is not some regular service mail.com but on thor network . The reason for i dont want to share the email provider publicly is i dont want anyone messaging spamming them and ruining the only chance  i have left to get the password and its letting  me try unlimited attempts to guess the password without captcha or  lock protection but  i havent had any luck.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: newuser001122 on May 06, 2023, 01:14:18 PMtrust me after a year of messaging this site owner its impossible to reach a deal with him and this is not some regular service mail.com but on thor network . The reason for i dont want to share the email provider publicly is i dont want anyone messaging spamming them and ruining the only chance  i have left to get the password and its letting  me try unlimited attempts to guess the password without captcha or  lock protection but  i havent had any luck.If they keep ignoring it for a year, you should get the message that they are not going to help you, and you should stop communicating with them, check this article and try some of the methods here.https://www.wikihow.com/Remember-a-Forgotten-PasswordIf you exhaust all means to recover your passwords it's time for you to move on and forget this whole thing maybe in the future it will just pop up in your mind when you least expected it.Move on, and enjoy your life there's more to life than stressing yourself to recover your email password.
